H0.text: in the dynastic cycle what is the right to rule called. Divine Right

H1.text: in the dynastic cycle what is the right to rule called. Imperial Authority

H2.text: in the dynastic cycle what is the right to rule called. Sacred Trust

H3.text: in the dynastic cycle what is the right to rule called. Mandate of Heaven

A4.text: The Mandate of Heaven (Chinese: 天命; pinyin: Tiānmìng; Wade–Giles: T'ien1-ming4; lit. 'Heaven's command') is a Chinese political doctrine that was used in Ancient China and Imperial China to legitimize the rule of the king or emperor of China.

A5.text: The Mandate of Heaven was often invoked by philosophers and scholars in China as a way to curtail the abuse of power by the ruler, in a system that had few other checks.
